# PE-2: Physical Access Authorizations
# Audit and verify physical access authorization records

echo "Checking physical access authorization audit..."

# Review user accounts that may correlate with physical access
echo "=== Active User Accounts ==="
cat /etc/passwd | grep -v 'nologin\|false' | cut -d: -f1,3,6

# Check last login times
echo "\n=== Last Login Times ==="

#!/bin/bash
# PE-3: Physical Access Control - Audit Log Configuration
# Configure auditd to log authentication events for physical access correlation

systemctl enable auditd
systemctl start auditd

# Add audit rules for login/logout events
echo "-w /var/log/wtmp -p wa -k physical-access" >> /etc/audit/rules.d/physical-access.rules
echo "-w /var/log/btmp -p wa -k physical-access" >> /etc/audit/rules.d/physical-access.rules
augenrules --load

echo "Physical access audit logging configured"
linux.ansible:
---
# PE-3: Physical Access Control - Audit Configuration
- name: Configure physical access audit logging
  hosts: all
  become: yes
  tasks:
    - name: Ensure auditd is installed
      package:
        name: audit
        state: present

    - name: Create physical access audit rules
      copy:
        dest: /etc/audit/rules.d/physical-access.rules
        content: |
          -w /var/log/wtmp -p wa -k physical-access
          -w /var/log/btmp -p wa -k physical-access
        mode: '0640'

# PE-3: Physical Access Control - Windows Audit Configuration
# Configure Windows Security Event Logging for physical access correlation

auditpol /set /subcategory:"Logoff" /success:enable

Write-Host "Security event logging configured for physical access correlation"
Write-Host "Key Event IDs: 4624 (logon), 4625 (failed), 4634 (logoff)"

#!/bin/bash
# PE-5: Access Control for Output Devices
# Configure screen lock to protect displayed information

echo "Configuring screen lock policies..."

# Configure GNOME screen lock if available
if command -v gsettings &> /dev/null; then
    gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.screensaver lock-enabled true
    gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.screensaver lock-delay 0
    gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.session idle-delay 900
    echo "Screen lock configured (15 minute timeout)"
fi
linux.ansible:
---
# PE-5: Access Control for Output Devices
- name: Configure output device security
  hosts: all
  become: yes
  tasks:
    - name: Configure dconf screen lock settings
      copy:
        dest: /etc/dconf/db/local.d/00-screensaver
        content: |
          [org/gnome/desktop/screensaver]
          lock-enabled=true
          lock-delay=uint32 0
          [org/gnome/desktop/session]
          idle-delay=uint32 900

windows.powershell:
# PE-5: Access Control for Output Devices

Set-ItemProperty -Path $RegPath -Name "ScreenSaveActive" -Value "1"
Set-ItemProperty -Path $RegPath -Name "ScreenSaveTimeOut" -Value "900"
Set-ItemProperty -Path $RegPath -Name "ScreenSaverIsSecure" -Value "1"

Write-Host "Screen lock policy configured (15 minute timeout)"

# Configure comprehensive authentication logging

Consider: flood zone mapping (avoid 100/500-year floodplains), seismic hazard assessment, wildfire risk evaluation, proximity to hazardous facilities (chemical plants, airports), crime statistics and civil unrest patterns, infrastructure reliability (power grid, telecommunications), and response time for emergency services. Implement threat intelligence integration for ongoing risk monitoring and scenario-based planning tools for business continuity. For distributed organizations, consider geographic diversity to avoid correlated failures and proximity to disaster recovery sites for failover operations.
